page.title: 12Tyred out!
page.content: The building was originally of wood, to keep chickens in, but rebuilt in brick by Mr. Charlie Rawding in 1948. In the 1950's V.Goodman and C.Robinson started selling tyres from the premises. Ten years later, the Michelin Tyre Company purchased the premises and still owns them today. They are run by a subsidiary company called Associated Tyre Specialists, Ltd., who own some 450 similar depots throughout the U.K. They also have interests in America and Holland. 1985 will see some dramatic alterations to the building when the front will be demolished and rebuilt. Next door is Mr. Rawding's cafe and lorry park.
